result.execSummary:
The defendant Alonzo P Greer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May transfer Probation to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with co-defendant or with JC Penney store listed in the criminal complaint. 
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alonzo P Greer in court with Attorney Justin L. Singleton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jim Fitzgerald appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Singleton makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #7:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

90  DAYS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR    **Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  

____No contact with: Co-Defendant or with JC Penney store listed in criminal complaint 

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($200.00) and remainder due as a condition of probation)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

CONDITION TIME:  20 DAYS, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court.   Defendant Alonzo P Greer did not appear.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is running late - court adjourns.  Case not called on the record.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2017 at 01:45 pm.
Sentencing hearing on June 12, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Alonzo P Greer in court with attorney Katherine Jean Graber.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State is in compliance with victim witness notification. Attorney Graber requests an adjournment in the sentencing hearing for time to speak with her client.  No comment from the state.  Court sets.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Alonzo P Greer in court with Attorney Katherine Jean Graber.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Shannon Tenney appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Graber requests a sentencing date. Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2016 at 10:30 am.
